page.title: 01Carluke, Central Lanarkshire
page.content: Carluke, unabsorbed a yet by industrial urban sprawl from the noth and separate form the rural community to the south, has its own identity. Population 11,000 in 1981; it consits of incomers and a close-knit locl cummunity, new estates surround the original town. To south and east lies open country with farms, used ad disused, and distric communities. Shops and services provide local employment, as does brickworks, a jam/confectionery factory, 2 local industrial estates and, outwith the area, a general hospital and Clyde valley market gardens. Commuters travel north, possibly to Glasgow; few go south. Basic sheps and faccilities exist (there is a pedestrian precinct) but for cultural events and specialised shopping travel is essential.
